content.description: Structural diagrams for two weak acids, <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <mtext>Z</mtext> </mrow> </math>, are shown.
content.question: Which acid has the larger value of <math alttext="K sub a" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mi>K</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>a</mi> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>, and why?

choices.label: <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because more hydrogen atoms per molecule can dissociate, decreasing the <math alttext="p h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the solution.

<math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the weaker London dispersion forces make the hydrogen atom more likely to be separated from the conjugate base.

<math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></math>, because the symmetry of the molecule results in a weaker dipole and a less polarizable <math alttext="O, H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>O</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> bond, making the hydrogen atom less likely to be separated from the conjugate base.

<math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></math>, because the electronegative <math alttext="C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms stabilize the conjugate base, allowing the acid to ionize to a greater degree than acid <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></math>, because the electronegative <math alttext="C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms stabilize the conjugate base, allowing the acid to ionize to a greater degree than acid <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 8.6: Molecular Structure of Acids and Bases

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
